hi and welcome you listening to the X

prepared let's get into the economic

they're doing whatever they possibly can

Irish government they expect it to agree
this week on a plan to move all of the
Republic's oil reserves out of the UK as
Ireland steps up its preparation for the
brexit now under the plan seen as one of
the most significant brexit decisions
for Ireland so far Ireland will transfer
nearly 200,000 tons of oil out of
British refineries and back into Ireland
or other EU Member States now under the
EU oil stock directive EU countries must
keep an emergency stock of crude oil
and/or petroleum products equal to at
least 90 days of net imports or 61 days
of consumption whichever is higher now
according to the reports one of
Ireland's options for moving the oil
reserves out of the UK could be
physically moving the oil via tankers an
alternative is also being considered to
make trade deals in which the ownership
of UK oil and other EU Member States is
transferred to Ireland without the need
to physically move the oil and we see
right now that countries they are
preparing for this breaks it and they're

this now of course do they really need

likely not they're citing national

we see that central bay
EU the establishment there they're gonna

what do we see happening here
well we're entering a point of no return

not just here in United States but in

look at the first stage mania prices

like X s central bank liquidity low
credit standards hot foreign money drive
a virtuous bidding cycle well above
sustainably affordable levels stage to
peak increasingly jittery owners attempt

inventory builds seller start having to
lower prices this begins a vicious cycle
buyers go on strike not wanting to catch
a falling knife causing sellers to drop

market is entering stage 2 the supply of

spring market rose at three times last
year's rate 30 of America's 100 largest
cities now have more inventory than they

new homes dropped nine percent
year-on-year and we can see right now
that we are in stage two and once we
move through stage two into stage three
we're done for
and that's where we are here think about
what is happening during this summer
